question: 欠席
sourceMnemonic: When a <kanji>seat</kanji> is <kanji>lack</kanji>ing the person it's supposed to have in it, there is an <vocabulary>absence</vocabulary>. Where is Johnny? Another absence? Ugh. Johnny. C'mon.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. Note that the <ja>けつ</ja> is shortened to <ja>けっ</ja> as <ja>つ</ja>s often are when in a situation like this.
